alert.note: Alert for Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 9:53PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTY THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1052 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles west of Town Of Santeetlah, or 15 miles north of Murphy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Citico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
